com.nttdocomo.ui
Class MediaManager

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.MediaManager
public final class MediaManager
extends java.lang.Object

This defines the management object of the media source data.
The behavior when obtaining and using the resource are indicated as below.

  • The resource object is obtained via the MediaManager.getImage method or MediaManager.getSound method. Minimum checking (checking the format, URLs for which access is forbidden, etc.) is conducted concerning designating the argument location. The resource object maintains the designated location.
  • When MediaResource.use method is issued, it is converted into an internal representation format by loading the resource from the location. At this time, a ConnectionException or UIException may be generated.
  • After issuing a use method, the resource object shall become usable.
  • When MediaResource.unuse method is issued, the internal representation format is disposed of and the resources (memory, etc.) necessary for maintaining the representation shall be released.
  • When the MediaResouce.dispose method is issued, the resources (memory, etc.) used by the resource object internally shall be disposed of. After this method is issued, use and unuse methods shall not be issued.
Minimum specifications:
  • The getData method returns "null" in the minimum specification.

See Also:
MediaResource, MediaData, MediaImage, MediaSound, MediaPresenter, AudioPresenter, VisualPresenter

Method Detail

getData

public static final MediaData getData(java.lang.String location)
This obtains the media data object from a designated location. When the format of the designated location is incorrect or when the designated address is forbidden access by carriers, an argument designation error is generated.
It may not be supported depending on the UE. When not supported , return value is null.

Parameters:
location - Designates a location.
Returns:
The media data object.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Generated when an illegal location is designated for the argument location.
java.lang.SecurityException - Generated when a security restriction is violated.
UIException - Generated when an object cannot be created due to insufficient system resources and the like .(NO_RESOURCES)
